Title:
Global phylogeny and taxonomy of the wood-decaying fungal
family Stereaceae (Russulales, Basidiomycota)
Keywords:
corticioid fungi, Stereaceae, three new genus, eight new
combinations, eight new species, identification key
Abstract:
An in-depth study of the phylogeny and taxonomy of the
corticioid family Stereaceae (Russulales) was conducted. In this study,
phylogenetic analyses are based on a concatenated ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 and
nrLSU sequence data of Stereaceae around the world. Three new genera and
eight new species are presented, and eight new combinations proposed. We
are provided brief notes for each accepted genus, Acanthostereum,
Confertotrama and Gelatinostereum, including information on
classification, type species and morphological descriptions. The newly
described species of Acanthostereum brunneum, Acanthostereum effusum,
Aleurodiscus globispora, Aleurodiscus subcerussatus, Conferticium
subtropicum, Gelatinostereum phlebioides, Gloeocystidiopsis shenghuai,
Stereum vietnamensis are introduced as novel species to family
Stereaceae. The new combinations Acanthostereum chinensis,
Acanthostereum wakullum, Confertotrama aspera, Confertotrama macrospora,
Confertotrama rugulosa, Confertotrama rajchenbergii, Gloeocystidiopsis
ravum and Gloeocystidiopsis tenuissimus are proposed based on morphology
and phylogenetic analyses. An identification key to all 17 genera of
Stereaceae is presented.
